about.title: From Kolkata and Varanasi to Stockholm
about.paragraph1: Growing up surrounded by the rich tradition of mehndi in the vibrant cities of Kolkata and Varanasi, I learned that henna is more than decoration—it's a ritual, a blessing, a story written on skin.
about.paragraph2: As a doctor by profession, I bring the same precision and care to my henna artistry. My passion for art and healing intertwines beautifully—where medicine heals the body, henna art heals the soul. After moving to Stockholm, I discovered something unexpected: the Nordic appreciation for minimalism didn't diminish the art—it refined it. Clean lines, intentional negative space, and purposeful design became my new language.
about.paragraph3: Today, we create henna that honors both worlds. Each design carries the soul of Indian heritage while speaking the elegant, understated language of Scandinavian aesthetics. As a professional henna artist in Stockholm, I specialize in bridal henna, mehndi designs, and henna parties for the diverse communities across Södermalm, Vasastan, Kungsholmen, and all Stockholm areas.
about.locationText: Based in Rotebro, Sollentuna, Stockholm, serving Stockholm County and beyond.
about.experience: 12+ years of learning, practicing, and perfecting this craft.

care.title: Henna Care Guide
care.subtitle: Proper aftercare ensures your henna develops beautifully and lasts longer
care.step1Desc: The foundation for a deep, rich stain
care.step1Detail1: Keep the paste on for at least 6-8 hours (overnight is ideal)
care.step1Detail2: Gently scrape off the dried paste—never wash with water
care.step1Detail3: Apply a mixture of lemon juice and sugar to seal the design
care.step1Detail4: Avoid water contact for the first 24 hours
care.step2Detail1: Initial color will be light orange
care.step2Detail2: Over 48-72 hours, it will deepen to rich mahogany
care.step2Detail3: Avoid excessive sweating during this period
care.step2Detail4: The palm develops the darkest stain
care.step3Detail1: Minimize water exposure on the design
care.step3Detail2: Apply natural oils (coconut, olive) to protect the stain
care.step3Detail3: Avoid chlorinated water and harsh soaps
care.step3Detail4: Exfoliation will fade the design faster
care.step4Detail1: Wear gloves when doing dishes or cleaning
care.step4Detail2: Apply oil before bathing to create a protective barrier
care.step4Detail4: Natural fading is part of the beauty
care.faq1Answer: Typically 2-3 weeks, depending on care and body placement. Hands and feet stain darkest and last longest.
care.faq2Answer: Yes. I use only pure, natural henna powder with essential oils. No chemicals, no PPD, completely safe for skin.
care.faq3Question: Can I shower after getting henna?
care.faq3Answer: Wait at least 24 hours before the first shower. After that, minimize water exposure and apply oil beforehand.
care.faq4Question: Why is my henna orange at first?
care.faq4Answer: This is completely normal. Henna oxidizes over 48-72 hours, deepening from orange to brown to rich mahogany.
care.quote: The beauty of henna lies not just in the design, but in the ritual of caring for it.

testimonials.title: Client Stories
testimonials.subtitle: Hear from those who've experienced Nordic Soul Henna
testimonials.tagline: Every design tells a story, every client becomes part of ours

testimonials.priya: Supriya's henna artistry is absolutely breathtaking! The Nordic-inspired designs she created for my wedding were elegant and unique. Every guest complimented my henna.
testimonials.emma: As someone who loves minimalism, I was amazed by how Supriya blended traditional henna with Scandinavian aesthetics. The result was perfect for my festival celebration.
testimonials.aisha: The attention to detail in Supriya's work is incredible. My photoshoot henna designs were not only beautiful but also told a story. Highly recommend her services!
testimonials.lisa: Working with Supriya was a wonderful experience. Her fusion of Indian heritage with Nordic minimalism created something truly special for my private party.
